intro: Spiloxene minuta, commonly known as the dwarf spiloxene, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes willows and evening primroses. The plant typically grows to a height of less than 10 centimeters, with slender, branching stems and small, white to pale pink flowers. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Spiloxene minuta thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands and along stream banks.
